Additional utilities for working with Tokio.

Run the following Cargo command in your project directory:
cargo add tokio-util
Or add the following line to your Cargo.toml:
tokio-util = "0.7.15"

content.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate tokio_utilCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/src/tokio_util/lib.rs.html#1-63)
Expand description
Utilities for working with Tokio.
This crate is not versioned in lockstep with the core [`tokio`](https://docs.rs/tokio) crate. However, `tokio-util` _will_ respect Rust’s semantic versioning policy, especially with regard to breaking changes.
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/#reexports)

`pub use bytes[](https://docs.rs/bytes/1.10.1/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bytes/index.html "mod bytes");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/#modules)

[codec](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/codec/index.html "mod tokio_util::codec")`codec`
    Adaptors from `AsyncRead`/`AsyncWrite` to Stream/Sink

[compat](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/compat/index.html "mod tokio_util::compat")`compat`
    Compatibility between the `tokio::io` and `futures-io` versions of the `AsyncRead` and `AsyncWrite` traits.

[context](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/context/index.html "mod tokio_util::context")`rt`
    Tokio context aware futures utilities.

[either](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/either/index.html "mod tokio_util::either")
    Module defining an Either type.

[io](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/io/index.html "mod tokio_util::io")`io`
    Helpers for IO related tasks.

[net](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/net/index.html "mod tokio_util::net")`net` and `codec`
    TCP/UDP/Unix helpers for tokio.

[sync](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/sync/index.html "mod tokio_util::sync")
    Synchronization primitives

[task](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/task/index.html "mod tokio_util::task")`rt`
    Extra utilities for spawning tasks

[time](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/time/index.html "mod tokio_util::time")`time`
    Additional utilities for tracking time.

[udp](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/udp/index.html "mod tokio_util::udp")`net` and `codec`
    UDP framing

# tokio-util
Utilities for working with Tokio.
## License
This project is licensed under the [MIT license](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/blob/4d4d12613bb30f6b550421d6ce2c2c54eb5d341d/tokio-util/LICENSE).
### Contribution
Unless you explicitly state otherwise, any contribution intentionally submitted for inclusion in Tokio by you, shall be licensed as MIT, without any additional terms or conditions.
#### Dependencies
~0.2–8.5MB  ~64K SLoC
  * [bytes](https://lib.rs/crates/bytes "1.5.0")
  * [futures-core](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-core "0.3.0")
  * [futures-sink](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-sink "0.3.0")
  * [pin-project-lite](https://lib.rs/crates/pin-project-lite "0.2.11")
  * [tokio](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio "1.28.0")[+sync](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio/features#feature-sync)
  * [compat?](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features#feature-compat "optional feature") [futures-io](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-io "0.3.0")
  * [rt?](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features#feature-rt "optional feature") [futures-util](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-util "0.3.0")
  * [rt?](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features#feature-rt "optional feature") [hashbrown](https://lib.rs/crates/hashbrown "new") 0.15[+raw-entry](https://lib.rs/crates/hashbrown/features#feature-raw-entry) tokio_unstable
  * [time?](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features#feature-time "optional feature") [slab](https://lib.rs/crates/slab "0.4.4")
  * [ optional ](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features#feature-tracing "tracing is optional feature") [tracing](https://lib.rs/crates/tracing "0.1.29")[+std](https://lib.rs/crates/tracing/features#feature-std)


  * dev  [async-stream](https://lib.rs/crates/async-stream "0.3.0")
  * dev  [futures](https://lib.rs/crates/futures "0.3.0")
  * dev  [futures-test](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-test "0.3.5")
  * dev  [parking_lot](https://lib.rs/crates/parking_lot "0.12.0")
  * dev  [tempfile](https://lib.rs/crates/tempfile "3.1.0")
  * dev  [tokio-stream](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-stream "0.1")
  * dev  [tokio-test](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-test "0.4.0")


#### [Other features](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio-util/features)

[](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate tokio_utilCopy item path

Expand description
Utilities for working with Tokio.
This crate is not versioned in lockstep with the core [`tokio`](https://docs.rs/tokio) crate. However, `tokio-util` _will_ respect Rust’s semantic versioning policy, especially with regard to breaking changes.
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/#reexports)

`pub use bytes[](https://docs.rs/bytes/1.10.1/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bytes/index.html "mod bytes");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/#modules)

[codec](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/codec/index.html "mod tokio_util::codec")`codec`
    Adaptors from `AsyncRead`/`AsyncWrite` to Stream/Sink

[compat](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/compat/index.html "mod tokio_util::compat")`compat`
    Compatibility between the `tokio::io` and `futures-io` versions of the `AsyncRead` and `AsyncWrite` traits.

[context](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/context/index.html "mod tokio_util::context")`rt`
    Tokio context aware futures utilities.

[either](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/either/index.html "mod tokio_util::either")
    Module defining an Either type.

[io](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/io/index.html "mod tokio_util::io")`io`
    Helpers for IO related tasks.

[net](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/net/index.html "mod tokio_util::net")`net` and `codec`
    TCP/UDP/Unix helpers for tokio.

[sync](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/sync/index.html "mod tokio_util::sync")
    Synchronization primitives

[task](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/task/index.html "mod tokio_util::task")`rt`
    Extra utilities for spawning tasks

[time](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/time/index.html "mod tokio_util::time")`time`
    Additional utilities for tracking time.

[udp](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/latest/tokio_util/udp/index.html "mod tokio_util::udp")`net` and `codec`
    UDP framing

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `tokio-util` crate provides a collection of utilities to enhance and simplify working with the Tokio asynchronous runtime. Key features include adaptors for converting `AsyncRead`/`AsyncWrite` into `Stream`/`Sink`, compatibility tools for `tokio::io` and `futures-io`, and helpers for IO, networking (TCP/UDP/Unix), synchronization, task management, and time tracking. It also includes modules like `codec` for framing and `either` for handling bifurcated logic.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Codec Utilities  
✅ **Factual:** The `tokio-util` crate provides the `codec` module, which includes adaptors to convert `AsyncRead` and `AsyncWrite` traits into `Stream` and `Sink` abstractions, enabling efficient processing of framed data.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `codec` module in `tokio-util` is designed exclusively for handling JSON serialization and deserialization over `AsyncRead` and `AsyncWrite` streams.  

---

### Pair 2: Compatibility Layer  
✅ **Factual:** The `compat` module in `tokio-util` facilitates interoperability between `tokio::io` and `futures-io` versions of `AsyncRead` and `AsyncWrite`, allowing seamless integration of libraries using different async runtimes.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `compat` module in `tokio-util` is only compatible with `tokio` version 1.0 and does not support earlier or later versions of the runtime.  

---

### Pair 3: Synchronization Primitives  
✅ **Factual:** The `sync` module in `tokio-util` provides additional synchronization primitives, such as `PollSender`, which simplify message passing in asynchronous contexts.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `sync` module in `tokio-util` includes advanced locking mechanisms like `Mutex` and `RwLock`, which are optimized for multithreaded environments.
